intro: Acetosella multifida subsp. vulgaris, commonly known as mouse ear chickweed, is a low-growing perennial plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its small, hairy leaves that are often heart-shaped or kidney-shaped, and its clusters of white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. It has a widespread distribution across Europe, Asia, and North America. Its botanical features make it well adapted to cool, temperate climates and nutrient-rich soils.
